intro: Heliotropium polyanthellum, commonly known as the tropical heliotrope, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant, violet-blue flowers that bloom in terminal spikes. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Heliotropium polyanthellum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
